bill_title: provide for periodic judicial review of status of children in custody of the Department of Corrections.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for periodic judicial review of status of children in custody of the Department of Corrections. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 26-7A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Within thirty days after a child is committed to the Department of Corrections under this chapter, or chapter 26-8B or 26-8C, and every ninety days thereafter, the Department of Corrections shall file a written report with the court which committed such child. This written report shall contain the following information: (1) The results of any assessments of the child concerning the child's emotional, mental, educational, psychological, psychiatric, medical, physical, or health status and needs; and (2) Information regarding the placement of the child within particular programs administered by the Department of Corrections; and (3) Progress of the child in programs administered by the Department of Corrections. Section 2. That chapter 26-7A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Upon review of the information provided in section 1 of this Act, the court may, upon its own motion, enter an order compelling the secretary of corrections to appear and show cause why the court should not order the discharge of the child from the department, order the child to be restored to the child's parents, guardian, or custodian, order the child to be placed under the guardianship of another person appointed by the court and placed in a suitable family home, or order an amended decree of disposition pursuant to § 26-8B-6 or 26-8C-7. At the hearing, the court shall determine if the best interests of the child will be promoted by the child's discharge from the department.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for periodic judicial review of status of children in custody of the Department of Corrections. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 26-7A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Within thirty days after a child is committed to the Department of Corrections under this chapter, or chapter 26-8B or 26-8C, and every ninety days thereafter while the child remains in a correctional placement, the Department of Corrections shall file a written report with the court which committed such child. This written report shall contain the following information: (1) The results of any assessments of the child concerning the child's emotional, mental, educational, psychological, psychiatric, medical, physical, or health status and needs; and (2) Information regarding the placement of the child within particular programs administered by the Department of Corrections; and (3) Progress of the child in programs administered by the Department of Corrections. Section 2. That chapter 26-7A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Upon review of the information provided in section 1 of this Act, the court may, upon its own motion, enter an order compelling the secretary of corrections to appear and show cause why the court should not order the discharge of the child from the department, order the child to be restored to the child's parents, guardian, or custodian, order the child to be placed under the guardianship of another person appointed by the court and placed in a suitable family home, or order an amended decree of disposition pursuant to § 26-8B-6 or 26-8C-7. At the hearing, the court shall determine if the best interests of the child will be promoted by the child's discharge from the department.
